item.title: tsibble? or tibbletime?
item.description: So what do these two packages have in common? A common time series analysis task is to aggregate the values to higher-level time periods. For example, it may be interesting to examine average temperature and total precipitation every month. Generally, tsibble defines a time series tibble more strictly than tibbletime…

item.title: Interview with Rob J Hyndman
item.description: The textbook is different. It really goes back a long way. I wrote a textbook on forecasting in 1998 and it became the biggest selling textbook on statistical forecasting in the world. My contract said I should get 5% of sales, but I actually got much less. Wiley (the publisher) had no costs apart from printing and marketing, and they did a lousy job in marketing…

item.title: Data analysis, from numbers to insights
item.description: For good or ill, we crossed the end of the world predicted by Mayans and were pushed back to a tough world. It’s time to move forward. Data analysis, as I understand it, is not a fixed set of techniques. It is a way of life, and it has a name: curiosity. There is always something else to find out and something more to learn…
